name: Countries
description:
It was the first project that I carried out individually, it saves in the prostgres database the information consumed from an external api to later be consumed from said DB. It was a very challenging project since at that time I still did not have enough knowledge, which led me to investigate many things. 

 Its objective is to show all the countries of the world as well as their information in more detail. 

 Below I list some of its features:
bullets: Shows the countries contained in the database.
Details of the information of each country.
Ordering of countries alphabetically or by population.
Filtered by Continent and by Activities.
Form to add activities to one or more countries at the same time.

name: Visit Matina
description:
The VisitMatina site was a project carried out as a team working together with a tourist alliance from Matina, Costa Rica. Its objective is to encourage local and international tourism in the area. Throughout the project, work was done under the SCRUM methodology.

At the end of the project, the site was delivered to the client, who comments that it will be very useful to promote the products and services of the region. 

 Features:
bullets: Creation of each business within the site.
User registration and authentication with Google.
Integration of personalized review system for each business.
Blog to publish news from the region.
Hosting of multimedia files in Cloudinary.
Contact of each business with nodemailer.
Operations to register businesses, products, tourist packages and blog news.

name: Portfolio
description:
This website is to show the projects that he carried out and that the people who enter this site know a little more about me.

In addition to using the technologies that he has been working on throughout Henry's bootcamp, I also gave myself to the task of using Next.js in order to keep myself updated.

Some of its features are:
bullets: Brief review about me and allows you to download my curriculum.
Links to my Github, LinkedIn and Email.

Throughout the entire process of Design addresses several stages in which different activities are carried out:

name: Google UX project 2
description:
This project was developed under the slogan of creating a website where you can find and view DIY tutorials, which corresponds to the Google career certificate: "User Experience Design" (UX).

 Throughout the process develop various activities in order to create a product that meets the user's needs and above all that provides a good experience when interacting with it:
description2:
Again I invite you to visualize the process as well as the result which you can find in the corresponding button.

 I appreciate your comments and as a good designer they help me perfect my work and continue learning.

 Important note: The prototype flows are in a single link which will display a menu with which you can select the one you want to see, if you want to see another one to return to the menu, open the link again.

name: Google UX project 3
description:
On this occasion I developed a project which aims to provide security to teachers and parents of children who attend kindergarten; This is the third and last project that I developed for the Google career certificate: "User Experience Design" (UX).

 For this project I had the freedom to choose a real project which I intend to program and implement in a kindergarten, at the moment I am still in the user experience development part but later I will work on programming. Like the previous projects, carry out all the design stages which appear below:
description2:
Just as in previous Google projects, I invite you to learn about the process as well as the result, which you can find in the corresponding button.

 I appreciate your feedback, it helps me perfect my work and continue learning.

name: Landing Page SAFE Refacciones
description:
I worked on a landing page prototype for an auto parts company; the main objective was to capture the brand identity and attract customers so they could learn about the company, the different sales channels it operates, and the branches it has throughout Mexico.

  This prototype is the result of the entire "Design Thinking" process, which culminates in a low-fidelity prototype, followed by the development of this project.
description2:
The project was implemented in a similar way, but on a server that could not run node, so we ended up using a template and working with Javascript, HTML and CSS.

 I appreciate your feedback as it helps me improve my work and continue learning.

name: E-commerce Shopify
description:
In this project I worked throughout the entire process from the analysis of requirements as well as the entire Design Thinking methodology in order to create an e-commerce that would meet the needs of the target audience and provide a good shopping experience.

 These are the main tasks I performed and I continue working on them to date:
bullets: Design Thinking methodology to prioritize the shopping experience on the site
Choosing the store theme, configuring e-commerce through Shopify
Integration of the front-end development environment using Github and Shopify CLI
Creation of custom components for the store
Design, development, and programming of the billing module
Front-end programming of the search page using an external API
Data loading using Shopify's GraphQL API
Using node to execute scripts and load bulk information

name: Pick up
description:
I developed this prototype to manage incoming orders through the branches of a test store on the Shopify platform. 

 The objective is to notify the staff in charge of picking when an order comes in on Shopify so they can fill it and send notifications to the customer when it's ready. It's worth mentioning that this is still under development, since a login must be implemented, which will include registering the staff who will be authorized to use this tool. 

 So far, it reflects the reception of orders and basic operations that the operator will be able to manage.
bullets: Using Pusher to manage orders in real time
